means: 插孔，（压载水柜）放水孔，密封采空区的密封孔道

sentence.Network_en: Germans worry that their economy is going down the plughole.
sentence.Network_cn: 德国人担心他们的经济会滑入深渊。

sentence.Network_en: Millions of pounds have gone down the plughole.
The water went down the plughole with a loud gurgle.
sentence.Network_cn: 水发着响亮的汩汩声流下了排水洞.

lj.lj_ly: the company went down the plughole.

entry.tran: （浴缸或水槽的）排水孔，出水口
entry.def: A plughole is a small hole in a bath or sink which allows the water to flow away and into which you can put a plug.
If you say that something has gone down the plughole, you mean that it has failed or has been lost or wasted.

example.ex: Millions of pounds have gone down the plughole...
Germans worry that their economy is going down the plughole.
example.tran: 德国人担心他们的经济会滑入深渊。

means.word_mean: 1. a hole into which a plug fits (especially a hole where water drains away)

auth_sentence.content: Plugholes Many people say that every plughole north of the Equator swirls the same way.
